server

Class Server

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • server.Server
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class Server
extends java.lang.Thread
    A Connect Four server which creates and saves new instances of ClientHandlers for connecting Clients. Hosted on local host and a given port.
    Author:
    Bas Hendrikse

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class java.lang.Thread

    • Constructor Detail

      • Server

        public Server(int portArg)
        Constructor, initializes instance variables.
        Parameters:
        portArg -

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Creates a new Server Socket and creates new ClientHandler instances for connecting Clients. Automatically starts a new game if a multiple of two clients are connected.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread

      • broadcastSuccesfulMoveResult

        public void broadcastSuccesfulMoveResult(int i,
                                         ServerGame game,
                                         ClientHandler clientHandler)
        Calls method for all client handlers to send a move result and checks if the game is over after this move.
        Parameters:
        i - The index on which the client wants to do a move
        game - The current (Server) game
        clientHandler - The client handler which requests the move

      • broadcastEndgame

        public void broadcastEndgame(ServerGame game,
                             ClientHandler clientHandler)
        Calls the EndGame method for all game handlers with the reason of the end game.
        Parameters:
        game - The current server game
        clientHandler - The clientHandler who did the final move

      • broadcastFailedMoveResult

        public void broadcastFailedMoveResult(int i,
                                      ClientHandler clientHandler)
        Calls a failed move method for all handlers with the index which failed.
        Parameters:
        i - The index on which the handler tried to do a move
        clientHandler - The handler which tried to do a move

      • rematch

        public boolean rematch(ClientHandler clientHandler)
        Registers if the players want to play again against each other. The method registers a rematch request of handlers and resets the game state if all game players requested a rematch.
        Parameters:
        clientHandler - The handler which requested a rematch
        Returns:
        If all game players requested a rematch

      • broadcast

        public void broadcast(java.lang.String msg)
        Sends a global message to all clients.
        Parameters:
        msg - The message

      • broadcastChatMessage

        public void broadcastChatMessage(java.lang.String name,
                                 java.lang.String msg)

      • getGameHandlers

        public java.util.ArrayList<ClientHandler> getGameHandlers(ClientHandler clientHandler)
        Retreives all handlers playing a game with the given clientHandler.
        Parameters:
        clientHandler - The handler playing a game
        Returns:
        An ArrayList with handlers in the game with the clientHandler

      • getHandlers

        public java.util.List<ClientHandler> getHandlers()
        Returns:
        all handlers connected to the server

      • addHandler

        public void addHandler(ClientHandler handler)
        Adds a handler to the list with handlers connected to the server.
        Parameters:
        handler -

      • removeHandler

        public void removeHandler(ClientHandler handler)
        Removes a handler from all lists containing handlers from the server. (Waiting handlers, active game handlers and global handler list)
        Parameters:
        handler -
